comments.creator: brunner.adam@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16

In a key event, the event.constants.DOM_VK_ENTER is 14, not the correct keycode 13.

I've found, that in TraceMonkey's source in file dom/interfaces/events/nsIDOMKeyEvent.idl, line 51 contains the wrong 0x0E, not 0x0D:
http://hg.mozilla.org/tracemonkey/file/743a77266bd5/dom/interfaces/events/nsIDOMKeyEvent.idl#l51

Reproducible: Always
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16

In a key event, the event.constants.DOM_VK_ENTER is 14, not the correct keycode 13.

I've found, that in TraceMonkey's source in file dom/interfaces/events/nsIDOMKeyEvent.idl, line 51 contains the wrong 0x0E, not 0x0D:
http://hg.mozilla.org/tracemonkey/file/743a77266bd5/dom/interfaces/events/nsIDOMKeyEvent.idl#l51

Reproducible: Always
comments.author: brunner.adam@gmail.com
bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text:
This has nothing to do with JavaScript.

What exactly says that DOM_VK_ENTER should be 13?  DOM_VK_RETURN is 13.  Enter and Return are different keys, hence need different keycodes.
comments.text:
This has nothing to do with JavaScript.

What exactly says that DOM_VK_ENTER should be 13?  DOM_VK_RETURN is 13.  Enter and Return are different keys, hence need different keycodes.
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.author: brunner.adam@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
You're right with that key code 13 (0x0d) belongs to the Return key.
Can you please describe me the difference between Enter and Return keys?
comments.text:
You're right with that key code 13 (0x0d) belongs to the Return key.
Can you please describe me the difference between Enter and Return keys?
comments.creator: brunner.adam@gmail.com
bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text: But note that this applies even to bog-standard 101-key keyboards: the key above the right shift and the key on the bottom right of the numeric keypad are different keys, and need to generate different keycodes.
comments.text: But note that this applies even to bog-standard 101-key keyboards: the key above the right shift and the key on the bottom right of the numeric keypad are different keys, and need to generate different keycodes.
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu

comments.creator: brunner.adam@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Additional link for the code: https://github.com/mozilla/gecko-dev/blob/master/dom/interfaces/events/nsIDOMKeyEvent.idl#L17

(In reply to Adam Brunner from comment #5)
> As I see, a comment had been placed to cover this issue:
> 
>   // DOM_VK_ENTER has been never used for representing native key events.
>   // Therefore, it's removed for preventing developers being confused.
> 
> So I'd close this ticket.
comments.text:
